name: BEAUTURAL Steamer for Clothes, Portable Handheld Garment Fabric Wrinkles Remover, 30-Second Fast Heat-up, Auto-Off, Large Detachable Water Tank
about_this_item: Detachable 8.79-ounce water tank for 15 minutes of continuous steaming to remove wrinkles perfectly
No leaking, no spilling with leak-proof design enables to steam whether vertically or horizontally
1200 watts with 30-second fast heat-up and powerful steam output dewrinkles your clothes in no time
Safe to use on all fabrics and suitable for clothes, curtains, furniture, toys and so much more
The lint brush and soft brush attachments are included to provide a variety of steaming options

title: Easy to use. Does a lot of fabric on one fill up
content: This steamer is good quality very portable and is not heavy even with a full water tank. Gets out stubborn wrinkles. Did a long dress on one tank. I've bought more expensive steamers and I'll have to say this one works way better so for the price it is a great value. You fill the tank from the bottom but the fill line is when tank it upright. So that's the only thing I would improve. I drew my own fill line for when I'm filling it, lol. Highly recommend
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I'm so happy I tried this. I hate ironing and haven't ironed in years. This is so much easier, just hang your clothes on a hanger and steam. Wrinkles come out FAST. Also it is perfect to get the wrinkles out of new curtains, etc. The price is great too.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Once I got this, I immediately pulled out a blouse that has been sitting in my closet for a year or so, in desperate need of ironing.  It is a 2-layer top, with the layers bound at top and bottom, so you cannot just iron one layer. The inner layer is tank-top like, made of a semi-thick stretchy material, and this same material is what is used for the waist band of the top. The outer layer is a very thin see-through layer that also stretches a bit. Even after being ironed, washed, ironed again and washed again, it still has some of the original shipment creases. So I decided to try this steamer on it. First thing I noticed is that trying to pull any stretchy material taunt enough for the steamer to really work well is almost impossible, making the steaming more difficult. There were a few areas of the sleeves that I was able to iron against the door that the top was hanging on, and those areas did come out mostly wrinkle-free. The thicker stretchy waist band was even more difficult to get the wrinkles out of. After using the steamer for approx. 15 minutes, and thus it was about empty, the top still has some creases here and there. Ultimately, I'm going to have to iron the top again. What this tells me though, is that it is likely only going to work well on stiffer material, whereas most of my wrinkle problems are similar to the top already described - some sort of thin flowy stretchy material. While it is possible that using this in a flat method might make it work a bit better on these stretchy materials, I already have a regular iron with steam ability, so I don't need that function. What I need is something that I can use quickly to steam out wrinkles. Debating on whether or not to return this one and try something else.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I purchased the steamer to remove wrinkle from a large formal dress and a thinner, more delicate dress. I expected it to take time on the ball gown, which was primarily tulle. I hung it up and steamed layer by layer, letting it dry some between the layers before moving to the next. The more delicate dress was also hung in preparation for steaming. It took longer than expected to remove wrinkles, and not all came out. I followed the manufactures instructions and let the steamer heat up well. It seemed too much work, for me personally, probably due to my age. It was not convenient nor easy to hold the steamer in one hand going vertically. I can go horizontally on the table with my steam iron, more easily. I truly believe I would have gotten better results. It seems to be made for small items; and will perhaps work well. Both my standard steam iron and the handheld steamer have nearly the same size box, so both should travel well. I did return the handheld steamer, as I personally had a difficult time managing with it. I took off a star due to the product not being a multi-generational product.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought this to replace a Shark brand steamer that is no longer in production so I couldn't get another.  The Shark lasted about 8 years and I really liked it so I wanted something that could live up to it's performance.  I was a little leery of this model because it is significantly smaller than my old Shark and I wasn't sure that the build quality and performance could be matched in such a small package.  A perk of being smaller is that it's boiling chamber is a lot smaller so it heats up a lot faster.  From plugging it in and turning it on, it's ready for steam in less than 60 seconds.  There are a few things I don't like as much and a some that I prefer in this model.

title: Verified Purchase
content: So here‚Äôs what I did. I turned on the steamer and removed the water tank. I then pressed down the trigger and locked it in place. While tilting it back and forth until water started to spit from the little spout. I kept at it until steamer started to come out from the grill. I kept going until there was hardly any water coming out of the spout and what sounded like a propeller inside got a bit louder. Connected the water tank back and finally STEAM!

content: I have never used a steamer before but thought I would try this one after reading such good reviews and also being recommended by several influencers on youtube.  I got tired of the ironing board and iron!  I really like the steamer.  It works as advertised.  Caution:  the steam gets hot!!!  The only reason I gave it a 4 star rating is because of the large size overall and the small size of the water container.  I have to refill the container several times if I am steaming a few things at once.  I disagree with those who said it would be good for travel.  In my opinion, it will take up a good bit of suitcase space and if you pack heavy and are going to fly it could tip you over the maximum weight before having to pay extra.  Overall, I do recommend it.

title: Easier Than Ironing
content: This was my first steamer, and it was quite easy to use. Remove the container, filled it, replace and plug it in. It takes less than a minute to heat up, and you'll know when the power light is steady.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I started in on the mesh layer of my curtains, and while it took a while because curtains are a lot of fabric, I noticed definite improvement. So far, I've only done the one layer of the top curtain, and there's a world of difference between that and the mesh layer of the other curtain. You'll want to stretch the fabric to get wrinkles out, which was easy enough with the mesh. I think I'll need a couple extr a hands for the thicker layer, however.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2024
